hook.text: 18 students from an LA barrio passed the AP Calculus exam. The testing company accused them of cheating. They retook it

buildup.text: Jaime Escalante taught at Garfield High, where many students were told they'd amount to nothing. He refused to accept

discovery.text: His secret: unshakable belief that every student could excel, combined with humor, intensity, and after-school

twist.text: When ETS questioned results, it was racism: they couldn't believe Latino students could master calculus. The retake

climax.text: Escalante proved that teacher expectations are self-fulfilling prophecies. Believe students can do it, and they will.
